fields.description:
*Description:*

Tooltips for Insert row on the editor tool bar have windows keys instead of Mac keys 

Issue is confirmed in v3 of Confluence Server 6.3.1 & above. 

 

*Steps:*
 # Go into edit mode on mac
 # Create a table
 # Click inside table
 # Hover over insert row buttons with toolbar
 # Observe tooltips indicate Alt button which is a Windows function. Should be replaced with option.
fields.summary: Incorrect 'Insert Row' tooltips on Mac.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

***NOTE: As the space characters are removed here in the current display of JIRA, view the notes below in "Text" mode to see the formatting and spaces in the example text snippets below.  Or, see the attached video.***

When adding text containing strings of multiple space characters into a table on a Confluence page, the extra space characters are truncated to a single space ' ' character after saving and viewing the page.

Example text:
 ---------
 Line 1 without spaces.

Line 2 with spaces at the beginning and in the middle of the text.

Line 3 without spaces.
 ---------

Becomes:
 ---------
 Line 1 without spaces.

Line 2 with spaces at the beginning and in the middle of the text.

Line 3 without spaces.
 ---------

This behavior is only reproducable specifically when typed into a table and using Chrome and Safari. Firefox maintains the space characters. Copying and pasting the text into the table also maintains the spaces. When adding the text in normal area on a page, retains the additional space characters as intended.

When testing this on Firefox, the additional space characters are retaines in the table as well as normal areas.
h3. Environment
 * Reproduced with Confluence (version 6.3.2 and 6.5.0)
 * Reproduced with Chrome (Version 62.0.3202.94 (Official Build) (64-bit))

It likely affects other versions of Confluence as well.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a new Page.
 2. Type in text containing extra space characters, such as the following:
 ---------
 Line 1 without spaces.

Line 2 with spaces at the beginning and in the middle of the text.

Line 3 without spaces.
 ---------
 3. Create a table of any size (2x2) for example.
 4. Type or paste the same text.
 5. Verify that the text in the normal page area retains the extra spaces, but the text in the table removes the extra spaces and becomes:
 ---------
 Line 1 without spaces.

Line 2 with spaces at the beginning and in the middle of the text.

Line 3 without spaces.
 ---------
h3. Expected Results

The extra space characters should be retained.
h3. Actual Results

The extra space characters are only removed for text typed in Chrome in the table.
h3. Notes

We can see in the Storage Format that the extra space characters that are maintained are stored as   characters.
h3. Workaround
 * Use Firefox.
 * Copy and paste the text with the space characters from another area on the page or another source
fields.summary: Extra space characters added to a table are removed when using Chrome or Safari, not Firefox

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 25th July 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
We've discovered that this issue is actually a limitation in Confluence described by the feature request at CONFSERVER-4337 and confluence is working as designed, so this is not a bug. Please see our [New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html] for more information and watch that request for further updates.
{panel}
h3. Summary

When copying text from Microsoft Word that includes an image, the image is not included when pasted into a Confluence page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page in Microsoft Word with text that includes an image.
 # Copy the content, including the image.
 # Create a new page in Confluence and paste the content.
 # The image is not included.

h3. Expected Results

The image should be included.
h3. Actual Results

The image is not included.
h3. Workaround

Copy the image separately and paste it.
fields.summary: Copying and pasting text from Microsoft Word not including images

fields.description:
h4. Suggestion Description [Confluence Server REST API|https://developer.atlassian.com/confdev/confluence-server-rest-api] is a simple resource that help administrators to perform operations that would take some time of their day to day activities in a couple seconds, instead of a couple minutes. It is a known fact that only basic authentication is supported when it comes to the API and the most secure you can get is through a MD5 hash in your request payload instead of sending your username and password as clear text. Turns out that there are several ways to make the API more secure, like for instance, interacting with SAML/OKTA or even using a Token Based authentication in-app. The intent of this suggestion is to enable the use of resources like SAML/OKTA for the REST API or to enable a Token Based authentication to provide secure communication in between client and application. h4. Feature Requests for different applications The same request already exists for Jira ([JRASERVER-66872|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-66872]), will be released for BitBucket ([BSERV-2722|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BSERV-2722]) and has been requested to Bamboo ([BAM-12095|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-12095]) as well. h4. Sample Payload Currently, if we want to create a page, for example, we would need to execute below call: {code:java} curl -u "adminuser:adminpassword" -X POST -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d'{"type":"page","title":"PageAPI","space":{"key":"API"},"body":{"storage":{"value":"

This is a page

","representation":"storage"}}}' http://myconfluencebaseurl.com | python -mjson.tool {code} As can be seen above, we do need to send an username and password at the header of the request to have it working properly, which is considered insecure. This is what we would like to avoid.
fields.summary: REST API - Improved HTTP Authentication

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Successful login count is not available in the HistoricalLoginInfo class.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add the successful login count method besides the ones currently available in HistoricalLoginInfo:

* https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-confluence/6.1.0/com/atlassian/confluence/security/login/HistoricalLoginInfo.html

h3. Why this is important

Customers may want to automate the request for this information which is not possible. We only provide the failed counters and last successful login date in the existing implementation.
fields.summary: Provide successful login count in the HistoricalLoginInfo class

fields.description:
h2. Summary

When enabling the {{confluence.extra.jira.async.loading.disable}} dark feature, the JIRA Issues Macro starts having issues.  The 'loading' animation will constantly show, and the 'Refresh' button no longer works.

h2. Steps to Replicate

# Link Confluence and JIRA together
# Insert a JIRA Issues macro on a page
# Enable the {{confluence.extra.jira.async.loading.disable}} dark feature

h2. Expected Behavior

JIRA Issues Macro will continue to work as it should.

h2. Observed Behavior

JIRA Issues Macro will load issues correctly, but the 'loading' animation will constantly display, and the 'Refresh' button will not work.  The only way to refresh the macro is to reload the entire page.

h2. Workarounds

1. Disable the dark feature
2. Enable Dynamic Render Mode for the macro:
## Install the Confluence Source Editor add-on
## Edit the page with the JIRA Issues Macro
## Use the Confluence Source Editor to edit the source of the page
## Find the JIRA Issues Macro code, and insert the following line:
{code}
<ac:parameter ac:name="renderMode">dynamic</ac:parameter>
{code}
(!) Making any further changes to the macro through the UI will remove the above line, and it will need to be manually re-added
fields.summary: Enabling 'confluence.extra.jira.async.loading.disable' dark feature breaks Jira Issues Macro

fields.description:
Hi, i found a few very old suggestions about table customization.

 

We use confluence for building an document management handbook (for ISO certification). Therefore we must implement some checklists as native confluence pages.

 

When we print the pages (via the Plugin PDF Scroll Export), we generate an amount of paper thats not necessary, only because the table rows are to high.

 

So my suggestion is: Give the user an option to change the height of tables manually...like the fixed size for the table column weight.
fields.summary: Table height

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you first install Team Calendars, and navigate to the Calendars page for the first time (http://BASE-URL/calendar/mycalendar.action) it prompts you to select a timezone:
[^Screen Shot 2017-12-06 at 11.35.35 AM.png]

However, it appears that the list of timezones here is much smaller than what is available when changing your profile timezone, or selecting one when creating a new calendar.

For example, I am not able to see any Alaska or Hawaii timezones. (i.e. GMT-9, GMT-10)

h3. Environment
* Confluence 6.5.1
* Team Calendars 5.3.20

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Team Calendars from Find Add-ons.
# Navigate to Calendars menu  (http://BASE-URL/calendar/mycalendar.action) 
# You'll be prompted to select a timezone. See attachment.

h3. Expected Results
All timezones available to Confluence users should be listed here.

h3. Actual Results
The list is a smaller list than what is available.

h3.Workaround
# Select a timezone.
# Navigate to your User Profile and [change the timezone there|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/your-user-profile-139549.html] (under Settings)
# Additionally, when creating a new calendar, [select the desired timezone|https://confluence.atlassian.com/teamcal/create-add-and-edit-calendars-654213559.html#Create,Add,andEditCalendars-Createacalendar].
fields.summary: Timezones missing from initial Team Calendar screen

fields.description:
h2. Summary of Suggestion

Currently, when configuring Space Permissions within the Confluence Admin section, at least 1 group is required to have Admin rights.  If you try to remove these rights, an error is thrown:

!space_permissions_error.jpg!

For security purposes, we don't want to give admin rights to all new spaces to a certain group.  Can these requirement be removed?
h2. Workaround

Create a group and assign no users to it.  Give it admin rights on this screen.  Alternately, just leave the {{confluence-administrators}} group as the only one with admin rights, as that group will have admin rights anyway, no matter what.
fields.summary: Remove Requirement on Default Space Permissions for a Group to have Admin rights

fields.description:
h5. Feature description
Currently it is possible to include on Confluence page any code with language syntax formatting by using bundled Code Block macro. 
However, sometimes it is required to embed in code block macro content that is changed dynamically (for example part of text file stored in github repository)
Please add a feature within existing Code Block macro (or add a new "github" macro) to retrieve the content from given github url.
fields.summary: Add github macro to display content of github repositories in confluence page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition Confluence does not have a checker to ensure that HTML tags are correctly inserted. example 1: image tags that does not have an image {code}

{code} Example 2: repetitive tags {code} {code} h3. Suggested Solution A quick check when a page is being updated to ensure that this tags are checked ensure that each tag does it correct purpose h3. Why this is important This crashes some of our third party plugin or cause browser performance issue due to not able to resolve the html tags. h3. Workaround # Install Confluence Source Code editor #* https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.editor.confluence-source-editor/server/overview # You will be able to view the HTML. # Remove the problem HTML code.
fields.summary: HTML tag checker

fields.description:

A better behavior would be to add Status or Summary of the linked issue too.

For example:

fields.summary: Summary for linked issue in JIRA Issue/Filter macro

fields.description:

Currently [Widget Connector|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/widget-connector-macro-171180449.html] provides support for the following:
* YouTube
* Vimeo
* MySpace Video
* Flickr
* Twitter
* Slide Rocket
* Google Calendar

Provide support for other video provides, such as youku.com, which is a Chinese site.
fields.summary: Widget Connector Support for youku.com

fields.description:
As a user, I want to be able to *filter and group results from Recently Worked On based on Spaces* so that when there are pages with the same name in different spaces I can go straight to the correct one.
h3. Problem Definition

Recently Worked On works as intended and shows the most recent pages that where edit in Confluence. However, when *more than one page with the same name in different Spaces* were recently edited, there is no way to visually identify from which page is each.
h3. Suggested Resolution

*Add a column* on the right or left side on the Recently Worked On screen that *shows the Space* from which that page is coming from and allow users to filter or group the results based on that new column.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Filter and Group Recently Worked On Based on Space

fields.description:
When collaborative editing is enabled, the page history displays the usernames of who edited the page but it is impossible to see who changed what when you view a previous version of the page.

Suggestion 1: could the text be highlighted with the color of the user to identify the changes ?

Suggestion 2: could it be possible to pick what piece of text could be restored ?
fields.summary: Ability to see who changed what in page history with collaborative editing

fields.description:
The RSS Feed macro in Atlassian Confluence before version 6.5.2 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary HTML or JavaScript via cross site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in various rss properties which were used as links without restriction on their scheme.
h5. Acknowledgements

Atlassian would like to credit Glenn 'devalias' Grant ([http://devalias.net|http://devalias.net/]) of TSS ([https://dtss.com.au|https://dtss.com.au/]) for reporting this issue to us.
fields.summary: XSS through various RSS properties in the RSS macro - CVE-2017-16856

fields.description:
It would be very convenient if the CodeBlock macro would allow you to provide a file reference via URI, ideally with starting and ending line numbers. Obviously this would need to be read-only since you won't in general have any way to update the referenced file, but even read-only access would be VERY useful in building architectural wikis. 

 

Some clarification: 

The problem I am trying to avoid that when changes are made to the file that the code in the wiki was extracted from - those changes are not reflected in the wiki. What I want is for the CodeBlock to retrieve the lines in question from the _current_ file and display them in on the page.  This should not pose any significant security concerns because you are only displaying source code (not executing it) and it can be escaped as needed to ensure it is clean.
fields.summary: CodeBlock macro should support file references as read-only code

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Confluence does not have a download all button for a single page. 

h3. Suggested Solution
To have download all page to individual PDF file with version name and compress it to either GZ or Zip

h3. Why this is important
For audit reasons.
fields.summary: Option to download all Historical version for a single page.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When clicking on a link that redirects to a row in a table, the row isn't shown as the header of the table hides it

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# On Confluence, create a new page 
# Create a table with many rows. The table needs to be long enough such that the header will become "sticky" as the users scroll through the rows.
# Add an anchor to one of the rows of the table
# On the same page, create a link to the anchor
# Save the page and click on the link created on step above 

h3. Expected Results
The header of the table shouldn't hide the row that has the anchor

h3. Actual Results
The row with anchor isn't shown. This is because it is hidden underneath the sticky table header. [Video of the issue|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/194190/anchor-link.mp4].

h3. Workarounds
Scroll up in the browser so that the hidden row will be displayed
fields.summary: After clicking on an anchor link which points to a row within a large table, that row is hidden by the table header

fields.description: want to create a report of completed tasks by date range IE tasks completed last week, tasks completed last month put in date range and select completed.
fields.summary: Task report macro - ability to report on completed tasks by date range

fields.description:
h2. Summary

The Confluence Datepicker (viewed when entering // into the page/comment editor) should not be considered to be "Autoformatting", and thus should not be disabled when a user selects "Disable Autoformatting" in their profile.  This is instead a keyboard shortcut.
h2. Suggestion

Allow this ability to be enabled when autoformatting is disabled.  Potentially create a new option in the profile to disable this ability in addition to the autoformatting abilities.
fields.summary: Datepicker Should Not Be Part of Autoformatting

fields.description:
h3. Summary
This issue needs a couple of attempts in order to replicate. It usually occurs after 4-6 attempts.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and edit it.
# Type some text, around 10 words separated by a whitespace is enough.
# Now, highlight each word and *click* on Bold

h3. Expected results
Highlighted text is bold

h3. Actual results
Highlighted text is not bold and the scroll jump to the top of the page

h3. Workaround
This issue occurs only in IE 11.
Using the shortcut (ctrl/cmd +b) doesn't replicate the issue.
fields.summary: When bolding a highlighted text in IE 11, the scroll sometimes jump to the top of the page

fields.description: It would be great to have an option to exclude questions from the labels list macro so that users can separate pages and questions.
fields.summary: Option to exclude questions from labels list macro
Upgrade jdk to 8u152

fields.description:
h3. Description
When the customer is having a large confluence instance and require more disk space for the DB temp folder to alter/update query when performing an upgrade. It will be better if we have a guideline or documentation on how to determine how many disk space is required for confluence when performing the upgrade depending on their instance usage.
fields.summary: Guideline for DB temp space needed when performing confluence upgrade

fields.description:
h3. Summary
With collaborative editing turned on and editing a page, autocomplete doesn't seem to work when searching on a user's email address to invite them to collaborate.  However, autocomplete works fine when searching by user ID or group name.

h3. Environment
This was tested in Confluence versions 6.2.1, 6.5.0 and 6.5.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a page with collaborative editing turned on and a mail server configured in the administrative console.
# Click on the "+" icon to invite users to collaborate.
# Search for the user by their email address.

h3. Expected Results
After a certain number of characters are entered, autocomplete should kick in to provide a list of matching email address(es). 

h3. Actual Results
Autocomplete seems to activate after you type a certain number of characters, but then it doesn't return a list of matching email address(es).
 
h3.Workaround
Enter the email by hand without relying on autocomplete.
fields.summary: Autocomplete should work for email addresses of users invited to collaboratively edit via "+" icon

fields.description:
Currently, the Lucene search index tokenizes terms like "super-man" into "super" and "man" such that if you search for either of these two parts, the page will return in the result set.

On the flip side, if someone were to search for "superman", nothing gets returned since the search term does not completely match either tokenized terms.

Confluence search should be smart enough to handle variations in whitespacing when it comes to search results.
fields.summary: Smarter handling of whitespaces in Confluence Search

fields.description: Currently, the Confluence email notification is all sent by using the email address defined in the "From Address" setting of the email server. It will be useful to allow to configure the sender email address per space which is similar to Jira that having the sender email config per project.
fields.summary: Allow to have the notification sender email address per space

fields.description: When we create a Confluence space of type "Software Development", we must specify a Jira Software project in the creation wizard to link a project with space. When we create an issue via Confluence in this space, the creation wizard proposes all Jira projects the user has access. We would like that this project list to be limited to only one project (the project specified during the space creation).
fields.summary: When creating Jira issue form Confluence page, limit list of projects to the linked project only.

fields.description:
As of 11/30/2017, Confluence Instance Health currently supports up to 6.4.3. As the latest version is 6.5.x now, we would like to see compatibility versions updated so customers do not receive warnings about this bundled plugin being incompatible with their newest version, unless it is explicitly being phased out of service.

[Confluence Instance Health|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-healthcheck-plugin/server/overview]
fields.summary: Update compatability for Confluence Instance Health for 6.5.x

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In our [Create a Template|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/create-a-template-296093779.html] documentation, the menu shows on the right-hand side along with the word Template:
 !Screen Shot 2017-11-30 at 2.24.31 PM.png|thumbnail! 

However, in 6.4.3 and 6.5.1 I have confirmed it appears more towards the middle, as a simple page icon:
 !Screen Shot 2017-11-30 at 2.18.53 PM.png|thumbnail! 

This causes it to be difficult to find by users of Confluence following our documentation.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Server 6.4.3 and 6.5.1 (as of the writing of this bug)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Step 1
# Step 2

h3. Expected Results
Template editor menu should appear as we have shown it in the documentation

h3. Actual Results
Template editor menu has changed its look at some time in the past.
fields.summary: Template editor menu appears differently than in our documentation example

fields.description: Using Quick Search in Confluence, for instance typing a '[' followed by some text (e.g.: [hello) or using '!' to search can cause a memory spike which results in longer memory cleanup cycles and results in long GC pauses, or possibly OutOfMemoryError's.
fields.summary: Quick Search can use lots of memory resulting in long GC pauses and OutOfMemoryError's

fields.description:
The current "popular labels" heatmap works for the entire space. We had a requirement where it would be great if we could get it to work only for a page & its children, not the entire space.

Hence, the new macro should create a heatmap only using the labels on a page & its children.
fields.summary: Heat Map macro that can track child pages

fields.description:
After changing the User Language preference, Activity Stream in Macro Browser does not change accordingly

*Steps To Reproduce*
 # Set user's language preference to German
 # Edits a page and opens the macro browser
 # Now the user changes the language in his individual settings to "français (France)".
 # Edits a page again and opens the macro browser (screenshot_2.png):

 
h5. Actual Behavior

While in German:

  !screenshot_1.png|thumbnail!
 * Activity Stream Macro in Macro Browser still in English (label 1)
 * Other Macro still in German (label 2)
 * All label in German (label 3)

 

After changed to French:

!screenshot_2.png|thumbnail!
 * Activity Stream Macro in Macro Browser still in English (label 1)
 * Other Macro still in German (label 2)
 * Some label in German (label 3)
 * Some label in French (label 4)

After clearing browser's cookies and caches:

!screenshot_3.png|thumbnail!
 * Activity Stream Macro in Macro Browser still in English (label 1).
 * Macros in French (label 2)
 * All label in French (label 4)

*Workaround*

Delete browser's cookies and caches and restart Confluence. Delete browser's cookies and caches is not enough to fix the issue
fields.summary: Activity Stream Macro does not respect user's language preference

fields.description:
After changing the User Language preference, Macro Browser does not change accordingly

*Steps To Reproduce*
 # Set user's language preference to German
 # Edits a page and opens the macro browser
 # Now the user changes the language in his individual settings to "français (France)"
 # Edits a page again and opens the macro browser

 
h5. Actual Behavior

While in German:

  !screenshot_1.png|thumbnail!
 * Activity Stream Macro in Macro Browser still in English (label 1)
 * Other Macro still in German (label 2)
 * All label in German (label 3)

 

After changed to French:

!screenshot_2.png|thumbnail!
 * Activity Stream Macro in Macro Browser still in English (label 1)
 * Other Macro still in German (label 2)
 * Some label in German (label 3)
 * Some label in French (label 4)

After clearing browser's cookies and caches:

!screenshot_3.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Confluence, if the user does have the *Add Page* permission on the space, the same will be able to access the *Space Tools > Content Tools > Reorder Pages* option, which allows the same to configure the order that the pages will be displayed in its tree.

However, if the user does not have permission to edit/view a specific page from the space, if the same tries to use the *alphabetical reorder option*, it will not work. It displays at it worked, but, once the reorder page is refreshed, the change will not take effect. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On a space, make sure to have a page restricted to a user that will not execute the reorder action
# Once you have the page restricted, log in as a user that does not have permission to access the same
# Go to *Space Tools > Content Tools > Reorder Pages*
# Make sure to manually reorder a page to a non-alphabetical order, so the option to reorder alphabetically will be displayed
# Try to click on the alphabetical reorder option and then, refresh the page/come back to the page

h3. Expected Results
The page should be reordered properly, or a message that the user is not permitted do to it should be displayed.
h3. Actual Results
No changes are taken.
 
h3. Notes
Manually moving the pages work. Only the alphabetical reorder option does not work, as displayed in the screenshot below:

!alpha.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
Manually move the page.
fields.summary: Reorder Pages Does Not Work If User does Not Have Permission to All Pages

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When Confluence is linked to 2 Jira instance, and when trying to create Jira issue by highlighting, it will be impossible to use or see projects from second Jira instance.

h3. Environment
Confluence 6.0.7
Jira 7.3.0
Jira 7.5.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Link Confluence to 2 Jira instances
# Enter any Wiki page and highlight any text, two options should appear.
# Click the 'create Jira issue' button.
# Choose either one of the connected Jira to receive the list of projects under it.
# The list of projects in the relevant Jira instance is displayed.
# Switch the selected Jira instance to a different one from the one selected in item 3.

h3. Expected Results
The list of projects from second Jira instance is listed

h3. Actual Results
The same projects list from the previous instance is listed.

h3. Solution
Upgrade instance to Confluence 6.2.3 or above
fields.summary: Creating Jira issue macro from highlight will show popup in which you can not change Jira Instance Project.

fields.description:
As a Confluence user, I want to be able to reorder multiple pages at once.

 
h3. Problem Definition

Users, even when with the necessary permissions, are unable to reorder multiple pages in Confluence. Reordering one by one add a significant amount of time to simple tasks 
h3. Suggested Resolution

Allow users to *Reorder Multiple Pages at Once* (Bulk reorder) with the Space Tools 
h3. Why Is This Important

When a Space has a significant number of pages and an element which forces a page reorder is inserted, the process can take too much time and add a significant amount of struggle to the user.
fields.summary: Bulk Reorder Pages

fields.description:
As an Confluence user, I want to be able to display data generated by New Relic inside Confluence.

 

Problem Definition

When a user has New Relic generating data, he is unable to show this data in real time inside Confluence. 

Suggested Resolution

Create a macro do work with New Relic API and receive data provided by it.
h3. Why this is important

New Relic is a known partner of Atlassian and as of today, there is no known way to use the data generated by it inside Confluence.
fields.summary: Provide a way to connect Confluence to New Relic

fields.description:
Some of the pages I build in confluence refer to a number of other pages using excerpts and the page properties report.

These pages can get very slow to load due to all the referencing.

I would suggest that for these pages that instead of always getting the contents from the referenced pages a cache of the current contents be created... and a job which checks to see if any of the referenced pages have been updated. If any are yes to the job then they would go get the pages.

:)
fields.summary: Page caching for pages with functions

fields.description:
Based on [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/advanced-pdf-export-customizations-198806890.html]:
{quote}If styling is not working as expected, it is useful to look at the intermediary HTML source to which the CSS is applied. This intermediary HTML is created whenever you create an HTML export that contains multiple pages, and is stored in the temp directory in Confluence's home directory. Example:

/temp/htmlexport-20110308-154047-1/export-intermediate-154047-2.html
{quote}
When we export multiple pages to HTML, the intermediate file is not created as expected.
 The files are created with the CSS styling included and there are no intermediate files in the export as stated in the documentation.
h4. Steps to replicate

1) Export multiple pages to HTML
 2) Check in Confluence home directory/temp

No export-intermediate HTML files are created, only the final export is located there.
fields.summary: Intermediary HTML not found in temp directory of Confluence when exporting multiple pages

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, the German translation for Confluence notification is grammatically incorrect. It should be "User Name hat diese Seite bearbeitet" not "haben" as 3rd person singular is "hat" (english "has" and 3rd person plural is "haben" (english "have")

Also, "B" is missing and it should be "Benachrichtigungen verwalten" (english Manage Notifications).
h3. Environment

h3. Expected Results

The email notification should be "User Name, hat diese Seite bearbeitet"

"Benachrichtigungen verwalten"
h3. Actual Results

The email notification is "User Name, haben diese Seite bearbeitet"

"enachrichtigungen verwalten"
fields.summary: Incorrect Grammar on German translation for Confluence notification

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When users misses out or forgets to add the space name while creating a Team Space and goes to add a long list of team members, then they are not able to scroll up to add or modify the space name. So when they leave space name field blank the create button will be disabled.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Team Space in Confluence.
# In the dialog box, just leave space name field blank with no values.
# Go ahead and add team members [say 15 - 20] till we see the space name field goes to top of dialog box and becomes invisible.

h3. Expected Results
A scroll bar should be appearing at the side of the dialog box to allow users to scroll up and add a space name.

h3. Actual Results
There is no scroll bar or any way to go to top of the dialog box, for adding the space name. 

h3. Workaround
Users have to cancel the whole process or go back then start creating the space from beginning, and have to make sure they enter space name before entering team members.
fields.summary: Can't add Team Space name after adding long list of team members

fields.description:
h2. Description

When editing a page, if you click on 'Invite People to Edit With You', the user search does not take space/page permissions into account, so you can end up inviting a person who has no access to the page.
h2. Steps to reproduce:
 - User A has edit permission on the page.
 - User A edits a page and clicks on invite user
 - User A searches for any user that exist in the system and adds User B who does not have any permissions on the space/page

h2. Expected Behavior

The user will not show up in the search, or will not receive the invitation to edit
h2. Actual Behavior

The user will receive an invite, and when clicking on it, will get the 'Page Not Found' error.

h2. Workaround

In the *Confluence Admin* section, go to *Stylesheets* and add the following CSS:
{code}
div#inviteToEditLink {  
    display: none !important;  
}  
{code}
This will hide the 'Invite People to Edit With You' button, preventing them from getting notifications.
fields.summary: Collaborative Editing 'Invite People to Edit' does not take permissions into account

fields.description:
h3. Summary

[Confluence Data Center CloudFormation deployment|https://aws.amazon.com/quickstart/architecture/confluence/] failed when StartCollectd parameter is set to false.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access our Confluence Data Center CloudFormation [page|https://aws.amazon.com/quickstart/architecture/confluence/] and then choose to [Deploy on AWS into a new VPC|https://console.aws.amazon.com/cloudformation/home?region=us-west-2#/stacks/new?stackName=Confluence-Data-Center&templateURL=https://s3.amazonaws.com/quickstart-reference/atlassian/confluence/latest/templates/quickstart-confluence-master.template] to launch the Quick Start template into your AWS account.
 # Next, you'll then be redirected to AWS page where there required parameters need to be inserted to deploy Confluence Data Center, please then insert the parameters and ensure that the _Start the collectd service_ value is set to *false*.
 (i) For more information on the parameters' value, please refer to our [Confluence Data Center AWS CloudFormation Deployment Steps|https://s3.amazonaws.com/quickstart-reference/atlassian/confluence/latest/doc/confluence-data-center-on-the-aws-cloud.pdf] documentation.
 # Lastly, please click on the _Create_ button to deploy the stack.

h3. Expected Results

Confluence Data Center EC2 stack would be deployed as per expected.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the _atl.log_ file:
{noformat}
...
2017-11-27 07:25:29 === BEGIN: service atl-init-confluence start ===
2017-11-27 07:25:29 Initialising Atlassian Confluence
2017-11-27 07:25:29 Checking if Confluence has already been installed
2017-11-27 07:25:29 Creating file /etc/ld.so.conf.d/confluence.conf
{noformat}
And we see the below info in EC2 instance system log:
{noformat}
Checking if Confluence has already been installed
Creating file /etc/ld.so.conf.d/confluence.conf
collectd: unrecognized service
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

To deploy the Confluence Data Center EC2 stack with _Start the collectd service_ (StartCollectd) parameter set to *true*.
fields.summary: Confluence Data Center CloudFormation deployment failed when StartCollectd parameter is set to false

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Page or Blog Post comments have no Pagination when there are too many of them. All comments will be displayed when loading a page or blog
h3. Why this is important

When there are users commenting to a popular page or blog post and the amount of comments get to a large number, loading the page can take too long and users may need to scroll down all the way to the bottom to make new comment. If the comments contains macro such as JIRA macro, it will further bring down the performance for loading the page.

Enabling comments Pagination can limit the page to show a certain amount of comments which should be able to shorten the time taken to load pages/blogs with many comments.
fields.summary: Pagination for Comments on Page or Blog

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian update: Released in Confluence Data Center 7.3|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6554c0|titleBGColor=#6554c0|bgColor=#eae6ff|titleColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone

Thanks for your comments and feedback on this issue. In [Confluence Data Center 7.3|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-7-3-release-notes-983794557.html], we released the ability to troubleshoot permissions problems. Space administrators can now look up a user, and find out exactly why they do, or don't, have permission to do something. You can even query a specific page, to bring in page restriction information. Administrators (people with Confluence Administrator or System Administrator global permissions) have even more power. They can search by users or groups across all spaces.

Please note that there are no plans to ship to this Confluence Server.

Head to [Inspect permissions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/inspect-permissions-992678939.html] to learn more, or check out our new [Permissions best practices guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/permissions-best-practices-992678945.html]. 

Thanks
 Makisa | Senior Product Manager, Confluence Server and Data Center
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Confluence does not have anyway to check on a user permission to a page. Permission Helper will help admins to troubleshoot the user access easily.
h3. Suggested Solution

To implement a permission helper like the one in Jira to Confluence
 * [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/using-the-permission-helper-868982879.html]

h3. Why this is important

There is no way to check if a user have access to a particular Space or page.Admins need to figure out why the user does not have access to the space by checking multiple permission such as Global Permission, Group Permission, Page Permission and also Restriction. By having a Permission Helper like Jira. This will help admin to troubleshoot faster regarding what is missing in the user permission level.
h3. Workaround

No workaround available.
fields.summary: Permission Helper for Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Replicate
# Add a table in a page
# Copy a text, double-click inside a cell and paste the content

h3. Expected Results
Content is pasted

h3. Actual Results
Content is pasted *outside* the table, removes the cell and breaks the editor by not allowing any other action aside from Update/Close.  Check: [^Recording #1.mp4] 

h3. Workaround
Affects only Firefox. 
Don't double click and paste a content inside a table cell
fields.summary: Editing a table with firefox breaks editing when double clicking + paste (ctrl+v/cmd+v) a text in the table

fields.description:
h3. How to replicate
# Add a table to a page
# Add a heading column
# Add some text to the *table header*

h3. Expected results
Table header is sticky when scrolling down

h3. Actual results
Table header is *not* sticky

h3. Workaround
Remove *all* heading column from the table
fields.summary: Table header with heading column not sticky when scrolling

fields.description:
As a user I want to be able to create links to specific pages in a PDF file.
h3. Problem Definition

Users are unable to add a link to PDF preview that shows the document directly in the referenced page. When attaching a preview, no matter how, users are always redirected to the first page of the document.
h3. Suggested Resolution

Allow users to create links to specific pages of a PDF document, almost like a summary in a document. Clicking this link, the user will open preview mode directly in the referenced page.
h3. Why This Is Important

When dealing with big documents sharing what is within them becomes a hassle because users will always start reading the document from the start.
h3. Workaround 

To implement something similar in a Confluence page, you could do the following:
 1 - Access the desired page with the PDF attached to it
 2 - Go to the *Attachment Section* (Little clip ot the right side of the padlock at the top of the page)
 3 - Click view in the desired attachment
 4 - Navigate to the desired page, the one you want to link
 5 - Right click and select *Copy image address*
 6 - Go back to the page and edit it
 7 - Paste the link you just copied
 8 - Save the page
 **Optional - Edit the pasted link name to match a desired specification
 Now, the link you pasted to the page will lead to the specified page. But, the limitations I spoke about earlier are
 - You can not navigate the entire document directly from that preview
 - When clicked, the page will open straight to the current tab, users must ctrl+click or right click and select open in another tab
fields.summary: Create Link to Specific PDF Page In Preview

This happens if a child page and a parent page both have permissions, and the permissions from the child page is removed, then the method {{com.atlassian.confluence.security.persistence.dao.hibernate.HibernateContentPermissionSetDao#getInheritedContentPermissionSets}} is invoked, then the permission from the parent page is removed.

Suspected Cause:
the 'join fetch' in {code}select pageAncestors 
from Page as page 
left join page.ancestors as pageAncestors 
left join fetch pageAncestors.contentPermissionSets as cps 
left join fetch cps.contentPermissions 
where page.id = :pageId
{code}
is eagerly fetching a value that may have been cached, and causes an error when deleting those values (as hibernate incorrectly sees cached items and assumes that it's being re-inserted(!?)).  Error isn't seen if debugging, since the speed causes hibernate to see the correct list of contentpermissionsets.
fields.summary: left joins in the getInheritedContentPermissionSets() call causes duplicate contentPermissionSet objects to be stored in the hibernate cache

fields.description:
h3. Summary

This is about a bug in Confluence 6.5.0 and later that I've already discussed with the Confluence team on App Week in Amsterdam. I wanted to submit this through the official channel as well in order to raise awareness a bit because this problem prevents us from marking two of our most important apps (Scroll Versions and Scroll Translations) as compatible with Confluence 6.5.


 Since this bug could break the content publishing workflows of our customers we're very reluctant to mark the apps as compatible. And while it appears not to be a bug in our code base, to our customers it looks like we're screwing up the compatibility update. We got quite a few update requests in the meantime.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Unzip [^duplicate-permissions.zip]
 # run atlas-debug
 # Wait until Confluence has started
 # Open the project in Idea (any IDE)
 # Launch the unit tests in the single test class; note @Ignore annotations in ContentPermissionErrorTest#works and ContentPermissionErrorTest#fails

h3. Expected Results

Unit tests should pass.
h3. Actual Results

Unit test ContentPermissionErrorTest#fails fails, see [^stacktrace.txt] for logs.
h3. Notes

Basically, the error happens whenever you call getInheritedContentPermissionSets on a child page (this is where the duplicates are put into the cache for the parent page), then afterwards call setContentPermissions on the parent in order to remove permissions. This exception is raised in HibernatePageDao in the method getDescendants() on query.list().

These calls do not necessarily need to come from within our plugin.
h3. Workaround

None yet

fields.description:
h3. Summary

A first consonant letter such as "k" goes away when you entered the next vowel letter such as "i" in Japanese IME environment.
h3. Environment

Client that runs the browser is
 * Windows OS (Tested with Windows Server 2012R2)
 * Chrome (Tested with ver. 62.0.3202.94)
 * Microsoft IME (Japanese) or Google Japanese IME

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a blank page and add elements as below.
 ## Add a section.
 ## Add a table inside the section.
 ## Add an information macro inside the table.
 # Save and close the page.
 # Open the edit screen for the page above.
 # Set IME to Japanese.
 # Type two letters (Consonant + Vowel)
 e.g.) Type "k"(Consonant) + "i"(Vowel).
 !k.JPG|thumbnail! 
 (You will see as above when you typed "k". IME is waiting the next vowel.)

h3. Expected Results

"k" + "i" should be converted to "き". ("ki" = "き" in Japanese)
 !ki.JPG|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

"k" + "i" becomes "い". The initial consonant letter is ignored. ("i" = "い" in Japanese)
 !i.JPG|thumbnail!
h3. Notes
 * Please note this symptom is different from the issue CONFSERVER-55177 because it reports that first letter is "auto-committed" while the letter is "ignored" in this case.
 * At the testing environment, it's reproducible only at the time of initial entry on the edit page.
 * It occurs only when you browsed from Windows, and it doesn't occur from macOS.
 * This occurs only at the Chrome environment, and IE11 also has another issue([Cannot type double byte characters in Section through IE11|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38758]). Firefox works fine.

h3. Workaround
 * Delete the affected character, and re-type the contents.
 * Use Firefox browser.
fields.summary: Unable to type Japanese characters correctly from Windows when page has specific combination of section, table, and information macro

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Confluence administrator are unable to explicity deny access to groups. They need resort to creating groups who can access and adding users to them intead of creating a "Denial Group". If a user is wrongly inserted or need to be in group X for other reasons, they will be able to access otherwise restricted spaces within Confluence.
h3. Suggested Solution
Improve permissions management and allow Administrators to explicitly deny access to specific groups. This way if a Space contains groups X and Y who can access and also group Z who can not, when a user is inserted into groups X, Y and Z he will be unable to reach such Space.
h3. Why This Is Important
It will give administrator more control and security over access policies within their companies and permissions control will become easier and more flexible within Confluence.
fields.summary: Explicitly Deny Access To Spaces for Groups

h3. Summary
When using a Confluence Search as an Unlicensed Access user (Service Desk Customer), the user is unable to get search suggestions (forever loop) and when the user hits 'return' to run the search, he is redirected to /dosearchsite.action and sees "Not Permitted" 

h3. Environment
* Confluence 6.4.1
* JSD 3.8

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Link a JIRA Service Desk project to a Space
# Create a page.
# Login as a Service Desk customer (user without Confluence or JIRA Application access)
# Login to Confluence.
# Search for the page in Confluence
# hit "Enter" on the keyboard

h3. Expected Results
Search results are shown.

h3. Actual Results
"Not Permitted" page is shown.

h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Search returns Not Permitted when Unlicensed Access searching

fields.description:
h2. Environment: 
Confluence 6.4.3, postgreSQL 9.5

h2. Steps to reproduce
# Create a new page, title should contain "+" sign for example: 'Page with a + sign'
# Add the excerpt macro and add some content to macro body
# Create second page with any title, add excerpt include macro and include page 'Page with a + sign' created earlier
# Enter edit mode and click on the excerptinclude macro. Choose "Go to Included Page"

h2. Expected result
Confluence will redirect to page 'Page with a + sign'

h2. Actual result
"Page non Found" error will be thrown

h2. Other info
* When  "+" sign is removed from title of the page, "Go to Included Page" feature works properly.
* Bug is reproducible as well with third-party macros Multi Excerpt and Multi Excerpt Include (part of  "Multi Excerpt" add-on)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Users that are expired in Active Directory are supposed to be removed from Confluence during the first sync after the expiration date.
h3. Environment
Confluence 6.5
AD 2012 R2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Set up a Connector in Confluence to sync with AD.
Tick "Filter out expired users" in the Connector tab

h3. Expected Results
Expired users removed when the Directory is synchronized.
h3. Actual Results
User is still in Confluence after synchronizing

h3. Notes
This issue is fixed on crowd 2.12, however Confluence 6.5 is still using Embedded crowd 2.3.3, and crowd 2.10.3-api
fields.summary: Expired Users from AD not removed in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The JIRA 'Change log' Report creator in Confluence no longer works. 
 When attempting to create a report the screen the 'loading' icon is displayed indefinitely and the report never loads.

This worked in 6.4.1, and broke in 6.5.0
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Version 6.5.0
 * Jira 7.5.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In confluence click on the '...' next to the 'Create' button in the top menu bar
 # Select 'JIRA Report' and click 'next'
 # Select 'Change Log' and click 'next'
 # Select a Project from the drop down menu, leave other fields as default and click 'create'

h3. Expected Results
 # The report is created and the page is loaded

h3. Actual Results
 * The loading icon will be displayed indefinitely and nothing will happen, the report is not created
 * The below exception is thrown in the logs
{noformat}
ERROR [http-nio-8090-exec-6] [common.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] toResponse Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: com.atlassian.confluence.extra.jira.JiraIssuesManager.retrieveXMLAsChannel(Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/util/List;Lcom/atlassian/applinks/api/ReadOnlyApplicationLink;ZZ)Lcom/atlassian/confluence/extra/jira/JiraIssuesManager$Channel;
 -- referer: http://confluence/display/650650/test+jim | url: /rest/create-dialog/1.0/content-blueprint/create-draft | traceId: cb8d51cecbc8fab0 | userName: admin
java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: com.atlassian.confluence.extra.jira.JiraIssuesManager.retrieveXMLAsChannel(Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/util/List;Lcom/atlassian/applinks/api/ReadOnlyApplicationLink;ZZ)Lcom/atlassian/confluence/extra/jira/JiraIssuesManager$Channel;
{noformat}

 * Error showing in the Chrome browser Console:
{noformat}
POST https://confluence/rest/create-dialog/1.0/content-blueprint/create-draft 500 (Internal Server Error)
{noformat}

!jira-report.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround 1

- Remove the current version of Blueprints that you have bundled with Confluence. Refer to the following guide to uninstall bundled plugins: [How to Remove Bundled or System Plugins|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-remove-bundled-or-system-plugins-648544751.html]
- Manually install new version of confluence-software-blueprints version 4.1.1. We have found this to work with the JAR file taken from Confluence 6.6.10. [^confluence-software-blueprints-4.1.1.jar]. A guide on how to manually install is here: [Installing Marketplace apps|https://confluence.atlassian.com/upm/installing-add-ons-273875715.html#InstallingMarketplaceapps-Installingbyfileupload].

h3. Workaround 2

"switch to advanced" prior to hitting "create" works for some users
 * The error will occur if *Automatically update issue status and summaries from Jira* is checked in the *Switched to Advance* settings

h3. Workaround 3

Manually create the page
fields.summary: Confluence 'Create JIRA Report - Change log' doesn't load - regression

*Summary* 
 Currently the Confluence does not properly handle events in the macros and will ussually throw some non-user friendly error in the UI and huge list of stacktace in the logs. For example if the "content by label" contains a filter to a deleted space, the Confluence will throw the following in the UI and a huge error of stacktraces in the logs. :
{panel}
Error rendering macro 'contentbylabel'
 parameters should not be empty
{panel}
These stacktrace flood the logs which make it hard for the customer to review their system.

*Step to Replicate*
 # Create a space (spaceA)
 # Create a page (page1) under spaceA
 # Add a label(test) in page1
 # Add 'content by label' macro in a Confluence page
 # Configure the macro as follows: label = test, of type = page, in space = spaceA then save the page
 # Delete the spaceA

*Expected Behaviour*
 * The Confluence gracefully handle the error by informing the user the space has been deleted
 * A short but relevant stacktrace that tell the user that the space is missing is added to the log.

fields.description:
h5. Bug Summary: 
Can't add attachment files when attachment contains uppercase special character in filename

h5. Environment:
Confluence version 6.5.1, database postgreSQL 9.5

h5. Bug description
It is not possible to view/edit attachment files (attachments) which have special uppercase characters (for example German "Ä"). 
Lower-case special characters like "ä" will not cause any problems. 
Problem affect postgreSQL database when database was created by using "C" collation/character sets. 
Confluence Encoding test will not show any warnings.

h5. Steps to replicate
# Create postgreSQL database with "C" collation encoding/character set 
{code}
CREATE DATABASE confluencedb
WITH
OWNER = confuser
ENCODING = 'UTF8'
LC_COLLATE = 'C'
LC_CTYPE = 'C'
CONNECTION LIMIT = -1;
{code}
# Link Confluence installer to confluencedb database
# Create Confluence page 
# Enter edit mode, instert to the page two attachments with following filenames:
- "Sample Ä character .txt"
- "Sample ä character .txt"


h5. Expected results
Both attachments can be added to the page 
h5. Actual results
- "Sample ä character .txt" is added successfully
- "Sample Ä character .txt" is displayed as "unknown attachments"

h5. Workaround
Change database collation/character set to utf-8 ot create new database with correct collation and move existing confluence data to new database
fields.summary: Can't view/edit attachment files when attachments has uppercase special character in filename

fields.description:
h4. Problem statement
When connecting Confluence to an already populated database during setup, the user will be redirected to a new page on whether they wish to overwrite existing data. If the user agrees to overwrite the data, clicking on the button will redirect the user to this URL:
 * [http://localhost:8090/setup/setupdbtype.action?dbConfigInfo.simple=false&database=postgresql&dbConfigInfo.databaseType=postgresql&forceOverwriteExistingData=true&dbConfigInfo.driverClassName=org.postgresql.Driver&dbConfigInfo.databaseUrl=jdbc%3Apostgresql%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A5432%2Fconfluence_651&dbConfigInfo.userName=confluence&dbConfigInfo.password=confluence&dbConfigInfo.dialect=com.atlassian.confluence.impl.hibernate.dialect.PostgreSQLDialect]

Where we can see the database credentials are being passed.
{code:java}
dbConfigInfo.userName=confluence&dbConfigInfo.password=confluence{code}

This URL is also appearing in the Tomcat logs:
{code}21-Nov-2017 21:31:29.476 WARNING [ContainerBackgroundProcessor[StandardEngine[Standalone]]] org.apache.catalina.valves.StuckThreadDetectionValve.notifyStuckThreadDetected Thread "http-nio-8090-exec-1" (id=34) has been active for 62,845 milliseconds (since 11/21/17 9:30 PM) to serve the same request for http://localhost:8090/setup/setupdbtype.action?dbConfigInfo.simple=false&database=postgresql&dbConfigInfo.databaseType=postgresql&forceOverwriteExistingData=true&dbConfigInfo.driverClassName=org.postgresql.Driver&dbConfigInfo.databaseUrl=jdbc%3Apostgresql%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A5432%2Fconfluence_651&dbConfigInfo.userName=confluence&dbConfigInfo.password=confluence&dbConfigInfo.dialect=com.atlassian.confluence.impl.hibernate.dialect.PostgreSQLDialect and may be stuck (configured threshold for this StuckThreadDetectionValve is 60 seconds). There is/are 1 thread(s) in total that are monitored by this Valve and may be stuck.
 java.lang.Throwable{code}

h4. Suggestion
Do not pass the credentials in the URL in plaintext form.
fields.summary: Hide or encrypt database credentials in the URL when prompted to overwrite existing data during installation
Upgrade Confluence to use JDK 8u152

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Stability and up-time are critical aspects in production environments for Enterprise clients. Often, we see one of the features from an add-on consume a large amount of resources causing Confluence to crash (OOME) or cause high CPU and thus Confluence becomes unavailable.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement a configuration option to set per-plugin (per-addon) resource limits (and monitoring) to prevent the entire instance from becoming unstable or unavailable due to insufficient resources.

h3. Workaround 
On these types of cases the process typically includes:
# Reviewing the support zip and thread dumps
# Analyze a heap dump
# Identify the problem
# Disable/troubleshoot the add-on causing the issue
fields.summary: Allow administrators to configure or limit maximum resources for Add-ons (plugins)

fields.description: It would be great if users could see the space where a page was modified when looking at the All Updates list. This would help them quickly know if the content was relevant to them, and allow them to easily distinguish between pages with the same name.
fields.summary: Show the Space in the "All Updates" list on the main page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a new table is added to a page using Confluence on IE 11, some changes will not be shown until the "Update" or "Preview" button is pressed. The behavior is presented regardless of Collaborative Editing being enabled.

h3. Environment
* IE11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Confluence with IE 11
# Create a table to your page
# Fill the first cell with some text.
# Use tabulator to move to other cell. This is important! If you use mouse when moving to next cell there will be no issue.
# Type text to the new cell, the cursor won't move and cell seems to stay empty. With tab you can move the cursor to next cells but the typed text will not be shown. If you change the cell with mouse and type some text the new text will be shown.
# Press "update". The hidden changes you made to the cell will be shown.

h3. Expected Results
The text will show up as it is typed

h3. Actual Results
The cell remains blank and the content is only displayed when previewing or saving the page.

h3. Workaround
Use the arrow keys or mouse to change cells.
fields.summary: Cannot use tab to navigate table cells in IE11

fields.description:
h2. Steps to Reproduce:
 # Install Confluence
 # Configure Attachment Limit via Administrations > General Configurations > Attachment Settings to 30MB. i.e: 31457280 Bytes
 # Create new page in Confluence
 # (Expected) Attach a 32MB file via Page > Attachments > Upload File > Confluence will throws a message stating file is too large.
 # (BUG) Attach lot larger file like 47MB via Page > Attachments > Upload File >
 !AttachFiles.png|thumbnail!

h2. Expected Result

Confluence will throws the message "Total upload size is too large (X MB). Reduce total filesize to below X MB"
 !ExpectedMessage.png|thumbnail!
h2. Actual Result
* In Chrome, {{ERR_CONNECTION_RESET}} is thrown in the browser. 
* In Firefox {{The connection was reset}} is thrown
* In atlassian-confluence.log, following traces can be found:
{code}
2017-11-21 22:51:34,826 ERROR [http-nio-8621-exec-5] [com.atlassian.xwork.FileUploadUtils] checkMultiPartRequestForErrors java.io.IOException: Content Length Error (31460203 > 31457280)
 -- url: /confluence/pages/doattachfile.action | page: 4227074 | traceId: c0dcbdcaa180636c | userName: johndoe | referer: http://localhost:8621/confluence/pages/doattachfile.action?pageId=4227074 | action: doattachfile
{code}

 

h4. Workaround
Use Drag & Drop instead of Upload File
fields.summary: Confluence Throws Non User Friendly Message When Uploading File A Lot Larger Than Limit

fields.description: The translation for the Widget Connector makro is wrong in German.
fields.summary: Improve German translation

fields.description:
Confluence installer provides an option to install application as a service. Such option uses *System V init* initialization system to install Confluence as a service, however it will not work with newest Linux distributions (Debian9.1, Ubuntu 17.10) as these distros are not supporting Sys Vinit anymore (only systemd is supported).

Feature suggestion: 
* It should be possible to choose during Confluence installation if it is installed as init or as systemd service.
fields.summary: Include systemd in confluence service installation

fields.description:
In certain areas inline comments don't make sense or would create page comments anyway, for example in macros that create dynamic content. An actual use case are the news feed macros in our Enterprise News Bundle ([https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/net.seibertmedia.confluence.enterprise-news-bundle/server/overview]).

It would be great if we could disable inline comments somehow for our macro output, e.g., by adding a special CSS class or attribute to our macro container.
fields.summary: Provide means to disable inline comments selectively

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When we have working variable with list values, list is appended with another value "false". This value is sometimes appended several times so at the end we haw list that looks like this : ValueA,ValueB,ValueC,ValueD,false,false,false,false.
This usualy happens when we switch Confluence node and continue to edit on second node.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 6.3.1 Datacenter 
* Two nodes in cluster
* MSSQL 2012 database in always on availability group 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit on node 1 
# Shut down node 1 and we saved template on node 2. 
# Did failover again from node 2 back to node 1, all variables still in place.
# After failover we have another false value in list variable.

h3. Expected Results
No unintended extra string is appended

h3. Actual Results
{{false}} is appended in the list
 !false apend to end of list.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
We tested failover between nodes with template open in edit mode. We think that this false value is happening on each failover.
fields.summary: Variable list in templates gets appended with "false"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Users are not able to customize Confluence "All Update" either to remove it completely or increase functionilty

h3. Suggested Solution
To make it like other add-ons with  menu option

h3. Why this is important
 All updates can be really useful for companies or they do not need it completelly. 

h3. Workaround 
Do not want to show "All Update" 
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-the-site-home-page-138140.html

Increase Functionality
* No workaround
fields.summary: Ability to customize "All updates" on the Dashboard

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Setting context path to '/resources' breaks UI

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.10 or above
* Issue does not occur in earlier versions (tested with 5.9)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Shutdown Confluence
# Change the [context path|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-change-the-confluence-context-path-707985922.html] to be:
{code}
 <Context path="/resources" docBase="../confluence" debug="0" reloadable="false" useHttpOnly="true">
{code}

h3. Expected Results
Confluence is accessible through {{<base-url>/resources}}

h3. Actual Results
UI is broken: 
!ui.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Notes
We've confirmed the following and the issue still occurs:
* Cleared plugin cache
* Changed context path to different word
* Confirmed the context path is added in confluence.cfg.xml

h3.Workaround
* Change the context path to a different word, for example to 'confluence' or 'wiki'
* Or, remove the context path
fields.summary: Setting context path to '/resources' breaks UI

fields.description:
h3. Summary

There is a space whose page hierarchy is as such:
 * Parent A
 ** Child 1
 ** Child 2
 *** Sub-page 1
 *** Sub-page 2
 *** Sub-page ...
 *** Sub-page 850
 *** Sub-page 851
 ** Child 3
 ** Child 4
 ** Child 5

When trying to expand 'Parent A', it takes up to 50 seconds. Once the 5 child pages have loaded, it takes another 90 seconds to expand 'Child 2'.
h3. Environment

 
 * Confluence 6.2.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Only users that do not belong to the {{confluence-administrators}} group are facing this issue.
 # Issue was tested on different devices using both IE and Firefox and it was reproducible in both browsers.
 # After enabling page profiling, we are able to see the delay is here:
{code:java}
      [46353ms] - XW Interceptor: After defaultStack: /pages/children.action (ChildrenAction.execute())
        [46352ms] - XW Interceptor: After validatingStack: /pages/children.action (ChildrenAction.execute())
          [1ms] - PermissionManager.hasPermission()
          [46231ms] - PermissionManager.getPermittedEntities()
            [0ms] - CrowdService.isUserMemberOfGroup()
              [0ms] - ApplicationDAO.findByName()
              [0ms] - MembershipDao.isUserDirectMember()
              [0ms] - MembershipDao.isUserDirectMember(){code}

 # When looking up the {{PermissionManager.java}} class to see what {{getPermittedEntities}} is doing and it seems that it's looking through the pages to check if any of them have restrictions.
 # A user who belongs to the internal confluence-administrators group. -> Acts FAST
 # A user who is not a site admin, but is a space admin to the affected space. -> Acts SLOW
 # A user who is neither a site admin, nor a space admin. -> Acts SLOW


Expected Results

    To have pages listed normally
h3. Actual Results
 * replicate the slowness but only while logged in as a user that does not belong to the "confluence-administrators" group.

{code:java}
[14154ms] - XW Interceptor: Before defaultStack: /pages/children.action (ChildrenAction.execute())
    [0ms] - UserAccessor.exists()
      [0ms] - CrowdService.getUser()
        [0ms] - ApplicationDAO.findByName()
        [0ms] - UserDao.findByName()
    [0ms] - UserAccessor.getPropertySet()
    [0ms] - SpaceAwareInterceptor.intercept()
    [14137ms] - PageAwareInterceptor.intercept()
      [0ms] - ContentEntityManager.getById()
      [0ms] - PermissionManager.hasPermission()
        [0ms] - DefaultSpacePermissionManager.hasPermissionNoExemptions(VIEWSPACE, athirah, ITSV)
      [0ms] - CommentAwareInterceptor.intercept()
      [0ms] - UserAwareInterceptor.intercept()
      [0ms] - BootstrapAwareInterceptor.intercept()
      [0ms] - PermissionManager.hasPermission()
      [14136ms] - XW Interceptor: After defaultStack: /pages/children.action (ChildrenAction.execute())
        [14136ms] - XW Interceptor: After validatingStack: /pages/children.action (ChildrenAction.execute())
          [0ms] - PermissionManager.hasPermission()
          [14070ms] - PermissionManager.getPermittedEntities()
When logged in as a user belonging to "confluence-administrators", this is the page profiling entry:
  [25ms] - XW Interceptor: Before defaultStack: /pages/children.action (ChildrenAction.execute())
    [0ms] - UserAccessor.exists()
      [0ms] - CrowdService.getUser()
        [0ms] - ApplicationDAO.findByName()
        [0ms] - UserDao.findByName()
    [0ms] - UserAccessor.getPropertySet()
    [0ms] - SpaceAwareInterceptor.intercept()
    [13ms] - PageAwareInterceptor.intercept()
      [0ms] - ContentEntityManager.getById()
      [0ms] - PermissionManager.hasPermission()
      [0ms] - CommentAwareInterceptor.intercept()
      [0ms] - UserAwareInterceptor.intercept()
      [0ms] - BootstrapAwareInterceptor.intercept()
      [0ms] - PermissionManager.hasPermission()
      [13ms] - XW Interceptor: After defaultStack: /pages/children.action (ChildrenAction.execute())
        [12ms] - XW Interceptor: After validatingStack: /pages/children.action (ChildrenAction.execute())
          [0ms] - PermissionManager.hasPermission()
          [11ms] - PermissionManager.getPermittedEntities()
{code}

fields.description:
Only 6 of user return in the search result of page restriction but none of them is the intended user. Not able to add the intended user to page restriction
h6. STEPS TO REPRODUCE
 # Add user with username test, test1, test2, test3, test4, test5, test6, test7
 # All the username must have the same Full Name: Test

h6. EXPECTED BEHAVIOR

Able to search and identify the user in the search result for page restriction
h6. ACTUAL BEHAVIOR

Search for the 'test' user but could not identify the exact user and none of them is the intended user and it hard to identify the user

  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h6. WORKAROUND
 # Temporary change the full name of the affected user to a unique name. But this could prove troublesome for the user that belongs to external directories.
 # Assign the affected user to a group and apply the page restriction to the group instead. This workaround will add another extra management to the new group

 
h6.
fields.summary: Limited number of users with the same name appeared in the page restriction search
Each column has same width in a wide table regardless of the contents on exported PDF

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition We currently have a count of the licenses currently in use in Confluence, but we don't have a list of which users are consuming these licenses. h3. Suggested Solution * Have a screen that will list out the users that are consuming towards the license, complete with the details on which group/user directory they belong to ** Somewhat like what JIRA have in their Application Access page. See screenshot for details !Untitled.png|thumbnail! h3. Why this is important When users have a Confluence instance with a large set of users and nested groups, sometimes the count is different than the actual number of users. It is important to know exactly which users are consuming these licenses. h3. Workaround h5. If using Confluence 7.0.2, or enterprise releases 6.6.17+ or 6.13.9+: # Go to the "Logging and profiling" administration screen # Add an entry for "com.atlassian.confluence.user.DefaultUserAccessor" with level "DEBUG" # Go to the "License Details" administration screen # Tail your Confluence log file # Hit the "Refresh" button under the "Licensed users" section # Look for a line like this in your log file {noformat} 2019-09-17 10:36:34,271 DEBUG [read-only-transaction:thread-1] [atlassian.confluence.user.DefaultUserAccessor] getUserNamesWithConfluenceAccess Found n licensed users: [user1, user2, ...] {noformat} h5. Ensure that only selected groups are counted towards the license: # Create a *group* with all users that should be counting towards the license; # Create a *new filter* using the group created's DN; # In Confluence, go to the *cog icon >> User Management*; # On the left sidebar, select *User Directories*; # Click to *Edit your current directory*; # Under *User Schema >> User Object Filter*, paste the filter created; # Save the changes and *synchronize*. h5. Use SQL query to list out users that are counted towards the license: [How to get a list of active users counting towards the Confluence license|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-get-a-list-of-active-users-counting-towards-the-confluence-license-298978076.html]. (!) However, the above SQL query will not list users that are counted towards the license as a result of nested groups. h5. Create a user macro: Create a User Macro Use the following code into the macro: {code:java} ## Macro title: Last Login ## Macro has a body: N ## Body processing: Selected body processing option ## Output: Selected output option ## ## Developed by: Andrew Frayling ## Modified by: Michael Seager [Atlassian Support] ## Date created: 11/02/2012 ## Installed by: ## Macro to display the last login date of users who have access to the current space ## @noparams #set($containerManagerClass = $content.class.forName('com.atlassian.spring.container.ContainerManager')) #set($getInstanceMethod = $containerManagerClass.getDeclaredMethod('getInstance',null)) #set($containerManager = $getInstanceMethod.invoke(null,null)) #set($containerContext = $containerManager.containerContext) #set($loginManager = $containerContext.getComponent('loginManager')) #set($users = $userAccessor.getUsers()) #set($count = 0) #foreach($user in $users) ## list the last login date of users who can view the current space #if ($permissionHelper.canView($user, $space)) #set($count = $count + 1) #end #end
Count User Last Successful Login
$count #usernameLink($user.name) $action.dateFormatter.formatDateTime($loginManager.getLoginInfo($user.name).lastSuccessfulLoginDate)
{code} Add the macro into a page (!) Do note that this is a macro created by third party. There is no guarantee that this user macro will be working in your version and in the future version. (i) Also note that this user macro will not count if the user(s) has no view permission to the space this macro is placed in. It is recommended to place this in a space that everyone has view permission. (Page Restriction however, is not affected) h5. Script based on the REST API If you use a specific group to manage access to Confluence, then the following shell script will give you the list of all users that are assigned to that group. [{{jq}} CLI|https://stedolan.github.io/jq/] is needed to format the API method output. {code:java} USRNAME=admin USRPWD=admin CONFBASEURL=http://localhost:6682/confluence GROUP_NAME=confluence-users echo "Username;Fullname" > /tmp/confluence_users.list REST_NEXT_LINK=/rest/experimental/group/$GROUP_NAME/member while [ "$REST_NEXT_LINK" != "null" ]; do REST_FULL_RESULT=$(curl --user $USRNAME:$USRPWD -H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "Accept: application/json" $CONFBASEURL$REST_NEXT_LINK 2>/dev/null) echo $REST_FULL_RESULT | jq -r '.results[] | "\(.username);\(.displayName)"' >> /tmp/confluence_users.list REST_NEXT_LINK=$(echo $REST_FULL_RESULT | jq -r '._links.next' 2>/dev/null) done {code}
fields.summary: Have a screen that shows a list of users counting towards Confluence license

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When users click {{...}} next to *Create* and then select a custom template they are not provided a prompt window for how the template works.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide the ability for administraotrs to create a prompt window for custom templates. An example of what that might look like can be seen below as the prompt window for the *Product Requirements* template: 
 !product_requirements.png|thumbnail!

Ideally, administrators would be able to create similar prompts, but for their custom templates.
h3. Why this is important

This will help users understand how to use any custom templates created in the instance.
fields.summary: Create customizable prompt window for custom templates
